pkgmetadata.longdescription: Methods in Mahalanobis-Taguchi (MT) System // Mahalanobis-Taguchi (MT) system is a collection of multivariate analysis methods developed for the field of quality engineering. MT system consists of two families depending on their purpose. One is a family of Mahalanobis-Taguchi (MT) methods (in the broad sense) for diagnosis (see Woodall, W. H., Koudelik, R., Tsui, K. L., Kim, S. B., Stoumbos, Z. G., and Carvounis, C. P. (2003) doi:10.1198/004017002188618626) and the other is a family of Taguchi (T) methods for forecasting (see Kawada, H., and Nagata, Y. (2015) doi:10.17929/tqs.1.12). The MT package contains three basic methods for the family of MT methods and one basic method for the family of T methods. The MT method (in the narrow sense), the Mahalanobis-Taguchi Adjoint (MTA) methods, and the Recognition-Taguchi (RT) method are for the MT method and the two-sided Taguchi (T1) method is for the family of T methods. In addition, the Ta and Tb methods, which are the improved versions of the T1 method, are included.
